subject: Re: test cases for inputs from file
msgSnippet: I do the InputSource thing as well. If you really must use a real file then I can think of 2 methods. o Predefine your test xml in a file in the same package
messageBody:
I do the InputSource thing as well.

If you really must use a real file then I can think of 2 methods.

o Predefine your test xml in a file in the same package as the test
and use ClassLoader.getResourceAsStream to find it or load it.

o Use File.createTempFile to get a temporary file and write your
test data into it. Use deleteOnExit to make the cleanup easy.

-- Neil Swingler

--- In junit@y..., "Vladimir Bossicard" <vbossica@t...> wrote:
> > Please guide me on how to write test cases where the input to the
test
> > cases will come as element values from a xml file.
>
> Instead of reading from a file, pass an InputSource to your method
(for
> example):
>
> String input = "<property name=\"name1\" value=\"value1\" />";
> myClass.read(new InputSource(new StringReader(input)));
>
> Remember: you don't want to test if the JVM can read the file, but
what your
> class does with the file.
>
> -Vladimir
